creator: sluggo@unknown.nu
text:
Can we have the following added to mime.types:

application/vnd.palm   prc pdb pqa oprc

See <ftp://ftp.isi.edu/in-notes/iana/assignments/media-types/application/vnd.palm>.

I realize that .pdb is already associated with chemical/x-pdb, but it seems to
me the registered MIME type should take precedence over the non-registered (not
to mention that a lot more people are distributing Palm DB files than the
chemical files). Anyway, if you don't want to re-associate that particular
extension, it would be great if you could still add the other ones.

creator: sluggo@unknown.nu
text:
Hi,

It was suggested by an httpd developer that I comment on this bug again to raise
it on the radar, so I am. This is a registered type, so please add it when you can.

Also, the URL I quoted above is no longer valid. The URL field points to the
official location of the registration.

Created attachment 14019
Update to Palm OS and WordPerfect MIME types

Associates the .prc, .pdb, .pqa and .oprc file extensions with the
application/vnd.palm media type.

Additionally updates the WordPerfect media type as per bug 29889.
creator: dmh@dmh.org.uk
fielding@apache.org
text: Fixed when I did the complete mime.types revamp in r571614.
